a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Base Logical Model for Verifiable Credentials

description.value: Base Logical Model for Verifiable Credentials. Omits the credentialSubject. Non-abstract should be instantiated for each credentialSubject schema

short.value: Base Logical Model for Verifiable Credentials

definition.value: Base Logical Model for Verifiable Credentials. Omits the credentialSubject. Non-abstract should be instantiated for each credentialSubject schema
Sets the context of the verifiable credential
The value of the id property MUST be a single URI. It is RECOMMENDED that the URI in the id be one which, if dereferenced, results in a document containing machine-readable information about the id.
The value of the type property
Verifiable Credential Status
The date and time the credential ceases to be valid.
Verifiable Credential Evidence
The holder of the credential
The entity that issued the credential

The date and time the credential becomes valid, which could be a date and time in the future. Note that this value represents the earliest point in time at which the information associated with the credentialSubject property becomes valid.
One or more cryptographic proofs that can be used to detect tampering and verify the authorship

Valid Until
